        public static java.lang.String[] VALID_URL_SCHEMES

    • Method Detail

      • isValidURL

        public static boolean isValidURL(java.lang.String candidateString)

        Checks that the specified string meets the requirements of the URL specification.

        Parameters:
        candidateString - The string to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if the specified string qualifies as a URL and False otherwise.

      • downloadRemoteData

        public static byte[] downloadRemoteData(java.net.URL location,
                                        int timeout)

        Reads the data at the specified URL or times out if unable to connect to the location within the specified interval.

        Parameters:
        location - The URL to be read.
        timeout - The timeout for accessing the location. Note that a timeout of zero is interpreted as infinity, and that negative timeouts are not permitted.
        Returns:
        A byte array which contains the data read from the URL.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs reading the data at the specified URL.
        See Also:
        StreamReadWriteUtilities.readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream)

      • downloadRemoteData

        public static byte[] downloadRemoteData(java.net.URL location,
                                        java.net.Proxy proxy,
                                        int timeout)

        Reads the data at the specified URL, using the given Proxy or times out if unable to connect to the location within the specified interval.

        Parameters:
        location - The URL to be read.
        proxy - The Proxy
        timeout - The timeout for accessing the location. Note that a timeout of zero is interpreted as infinity, and that negative timeouts are not permitted.
        Returns:
        A byte array which contains the data read from the URL.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs reading the data at the specified URL.
        See Also:
        StreamReadWriteUtilities.readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream)

      • isValidEmailAddress

        public static boolean isValidEmailAddress(java.lang.String emailAddress)

        Method which determines if a candidate input string is a valid email address.

        It accepts the supplied string as an email address, provided that it consists of a name and a domain part, both of which should be separated by the "@" symbol . Note that technically, this is the most basic requirement that an email address has to fulfil. As a consequence, you should consider the alternative of using a regular expression to test address validity.

        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The candidate email address string.
        Returns:
        True if the email address has a valid name and domain part, else False.
        See Also:
        hasNameAndDomain(String)

      • parseEmailAddresses

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> parseEmailAddresses(java.lang.String addresses)

        Parses a concatenation of email addresses into a list of strings. It assumes that the addresses are delimited by the ";" character.

        Parameters:
        addresses - The addresses to be parsed.
        Returns:
        A List of strings, where each element corresponds to a single email address as obtained by splitting the concatenated addresses.

      • getProxy

        public static java.net.Proxy getProxy(java.net.URL url)

        Returns the first available proxy for the given URL.

        Parameters:
        url - The URL for which to return a proxy.
        Returns:
        A proxy which can be used to reach the given URL if one exists, and false otherwise.
